channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024020582
item.description:
Report E-2024020582

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: FITCHBURG
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee was at the customer site loading flammable liquid into the tanker truck. Once the truck was loaded, the Veolia driver communicated to the customer that the loading process was complete. While shutting down the pumping operations the customer did not follow the proper shutdown sequence and prematurely closed the internal valve on the tank the flammable liquid was pumped from. This action increased the pressure on the vapor recovery line and resulted in blowing the line off the valve of the tank truck releasing a mist of flammable liquid.

item.title: Report E-2024020596
item.description:
Report E-2024020596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES L
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN2491 was damaged in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the ethanolamine solution-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack. All waste was staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021514
item.description:
Report X-2024021514

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found the box in the hazmat cage damaged. DescribePack: The box is wet and corroded. Once opened, found that one of four plastic bottles has a broken cap and bad under cap seal. all the other bottles are covered in the damaged bottles contents. about 2 quarts has leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All was put into a plastic spill bag lined black tote, and then into the cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021518
item.description:
Report X-2024021518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: EAU CLAIRE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer 827981 from 532-MILW was opened roughly around 1:30. Container had been loaded upside down at back of trailer, and fell out when door of trailer was opened. Container had leaked in trailer, and was further damaged by hitting concrete floor. Paint began leaking profusely. DescribePack: Lid bent, side of container dented heavily enough to break seal on lid significantly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately turning container upright. Soaking up and covering spilled paint.

DescribePack: The side of one of the bottles had a crack in it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and given to QA to inspect for damage.

item.title: Report E-2024020602
item.description:
Report E-2024020602

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of Carboline Urethane Converter 8800 was released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The release impacted the packaging only. The caller stated this was already cleaned up before calling ERTS. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are ok to have placed the waste material into (1) 5-gallon DM.

item.title: Report X-2024021339
item.description:
Report X-2024021339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: EAU CLAIRE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Undiscovered hazmat package discovered wet on bulk truck during unload on Outbound sort. Package was removed from vehicle and inspected. It was found that the contents were hazardous materials with no accompanying paperwork. DescribePack: All four bottles in the package had leaked due to the caps not being properly secured. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin and put underneath ventilation system in hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021301
item.description:
Report X-2024021301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SYSTEM. DURING CLEANUP IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THIS NON-LEAKING PACKAGE CONTAINED AN AEROSOL CAN, BUT POSSESSED NO ORM-D LABEL TO INDICATE ANY SUCH CONTENTS.
